title: Clean Air Zone PCN for people with disabilities

content:
Hello there, I wondered if you could tell me what adjustments you make for neurodivergent drivers who enter the CAZ and may forget to pay the charge.
Could you also tell me if you send drivers a text or letter to let them know they entered the zone before you issue the PCN?
Yours faithfully,
Hayley Hemming

Dear Hayley Hemming,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Clean Air Zone PCN
for people with disabilities which we received on 18/11/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Hello there, I wondered if you could tell me what adjustments you make for
neurodivergent drivers who enter the CAZ and may forget to pay the charge.
We encourage motorists with specific conditions to appeal their PCNs,
following the instructions on the Notice to Owner.  Each appeal will be
considered on a case-by-case basis, taking into account individual
circumstances and relevant policies.
Could you also tell me if you send drivers a text or letter to let them
know they entered the zone before you issue the PCN?
No individual notifications are sent to motorists to confirm entry into
the Clean Air Zone, as the system is self-declaratory with the user
identifying and declaring the date of travel, in order to make a payment
of the daily user charge online via GOV.UK, in advance, on the day of use
or afterwards within 6 days.
Once the road user charge payment window has lapsed, the original date of
travel will no longer show as an option for selection for payment. Only if
payment for the actual day of use is not made, is the Council notified by
the online system of the contravention so that a PCN can be issued once
details are available of the registered keeper.
There are advance warning and repeated signs on the approach to the Clean
Air Zone to notify motorists of the enforcement of CAZ and to check online
for more information. There is also an interactive map on the Sheffield
City Council website for motorists to check its boundary, along with other
information - [1]
https://www.sheffield.gov.uk/clean-air-z...
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
